description: Erection of single storey rear extension
decision_conditions: Development  shall  be  carried  out  in  accordance  with  the  materials  specified  on  the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The roof of the extension hereby permitted shall not be converted or used as a balcony or a sitting out area, and no access shall be gained except for maintenance purposes.Reason: To protect the amenities and privacy of the adjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

For any terrace area exceeding 30cm in height when measured from the existing ground levels, details of privacy screens positioned on the common boundary with Nos 14 and 18 Beaconsfield Road along the patio area, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any works on site are commenced. The privacy screens shall then be built and permanently retained in accordance with these approved details.Reason: In order to ensure the privacy of adjoining occupiers is retained in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments, including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

It has not been demonstrated that the proposed outbuilding would not exceed 2.5 in height. The proposed outbuilding would be sited on an existing platform and cumulatively, the proposal would have a total height of 2.7m falling outside E1.(e) (ii), of Class E, Part 1, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) (GPDO); the proposal height would need to be measured from ground level and it has not been demonstrated that the platform constitutes 'ground level' for the purposes of the GPDO.

The fee for 2 dwellings (2x £462.00) is £924.00 and the fee for rear extension in shop area (25.8 sqm) is £234.00. The total fee for your application is £1158.00. We acknowledge the receipt the £924.00. Please pay the outstanding balance of £234.00. Payment can be made online via the Kingston council website or our Contact Centre on 020 8547 5002
